welcome back it's been a while since
i've opened up some new art supplies
with you all so let's first start with
this package i received from choosing
keeping choosing keeping is a beautiful
stationery store in london and a really
old friend to this channel that
prioritizes researching and developing
where they source their products
resulting in a really special curation
of unique unusual and timeless items
they have a really unique selection of
art supply so i'm always eager to see
what new items they've sourced with
every package i received from them i'm
always stunned at the amount of time and
care they take to package each item if
you choose to get your items wrapped
each one comes in beautiful artisanal
paper and silk ribbons topped with the
shop's iconic bird sticker
[Music]
the first item i pulled out is a colored
pencil set from holbein hopeline is one
of my favorite art companies they are a
japanese company that i personally
really love because my first set of
watercolors were from holbein
[Music]
besides the fact that the packaging and
graphics of these pencils are stunning
these are artist grade pencils that are
incredibly smooth rich and opaque this
set is a concentrated version of their
larger 50 pencil set that highlights
only the muted pastel shades they felt
especially fitting because of the bright
spring weather lately
[Music]
i'll play around with these more in my
sketchbook later on but for now let's
just open up the next item one thing i
love about choosing keeping is how they
connect with many other smaller
independent shops and craftsmen while
sourcing their products and this next
item is a prime example of that these
are dry pastels made by rebecca wallace
and pip seymour who are two artists and
color specialists they are based in
north yorkshire in the north of england
the set was exclusively created for
choosing keeping and are meant to
recreate the feel and color shade of
natural mineral semi-precious stones
examples of these stones are rubies
azerite malachite satellite fluorite and
dioptas each pastel is hand formed and
are incredibly soft and velvety they can
be used wet or dry so you can make some
really versatile textures with these
the set of colors for this specific set
are so light and soft but at the same
time are packed with the maximum amount
of pigment because each one is made by
hand they have this raw quality to them
that i really really love
the next item i opened were these oil
pastels from japan i actually just did a
video about oil pastels that i'll link
on the screen so i was really really
excited to receive these these oil
pastels are actually really interesting
because they are essentially freezing a
point in history when oil pastels were
first produced these oil pastels
reference 1928 and are presented in its
original packaging and design where
during the thai show period in japan oil
pastels first originated oil pastels are
really fun because they almost defy
perfectionism and encourages imprecision
leaning towards a more free form and
experimental expression which is a style
that is closely linked with the era of
impressionism so i'm going to recommend
looking at my last video to see how i've
been using oil pastels but these pastels
specifically have been so much fun to
use because of their vibrant color and
buttery consistency
[Music]
let's take a quick moment and thank the
sponsor of this video green chef green
chef is a ccof certified organic company
that has meal kit options for every
lifestyle keto paleo vegan vegetarian
fast and fit mediterranean and gluten
free this is my first time using a meal
kit service and i honestly think i'm
hooked the box includes fresh produce
and premium proteins and i ended up
making a few recipes with my brother who
i never get to cook with nowadays it was
so easy because green chef includes all
these different recipes and ingredients
which come pre-measured perfectly
portioned and mostly all prepped so it
was all super low stress as you follow
the recipes green chef makes cooking so
easy because they provide step-by-step
instructions chef tips and photos to
guide you cooking the green chef meal
with my brother was such a fun and
wholesome activity i can't wait to do it
again with my friends use my code chef
pair 130 to get 130 off plus free
shipping on your first box or check out
the link in the description box below go
to greenchef.com for more details and
again thank you to green chef for
sponsoring this video
okay so from choosing keeping i also
received this italian straw paper sketch
pad which is made from natural straw
pulp originally used for frying and
serving foods it's produced by a family
family-owned art shop called ragachi who
have been making artist materials since
1925. i love drawing on toned paper and
the unique texture and grain of this
paper has been a dream to draw on so far
[Music]
i also received these really cute cat
and dog jelly stickers that are really
reminiscent of the 80s but i also grew
up with them in the early 2000s so
sticking these onto my planner really
threw me back in time for a second i'll
be playing around with these supplies
later on in the video but before that
let's go through some more parcels that
i received in the mail
[Music]
[Music]
so recently on instagram i've been
seeing a stationary company called odd
orange pop up on my feed and i ended up
ordering two of their sketchbooks the
founder is a fellow artist here on
youtube called morgan grist and she hand
binds all of these different notebooks
and sketchbooks using 100 recycled paper
i love that the packaging of the
sketchbooks as well as the sketchbooks
themselves are sustainable
[Music]
what i really loved about watching
morgan's process on youtube on making
these sketchbooks is how thoughtful she
is in considering the artist's needs
above all else you can tell that every
aspect of the sketchbook is meticulously
thought out from its lay flat quality
the weight of the paper and the paper
illustrations info cards containing
historical information about the
background of the sketchbook cover
colors down to the overall branding i've
been really enjoying drawing in my b6
150 gsm fine grain sketchbook in emerald
green and i'm really excited to see how
auto orange grows their line once i'm
done with the sketchbook i'm definitely
going to pick up a few more
so the next thing i received in the mail
that i thought i'd share was an order
that i placed on 10 by 10. this is a
korean marketplace that i used to kind
of online window shop on during high
school and i recently revisited it and
ordered a few things from their
stationery section so the first thing i
got was this canvas pencil pouch that
has a zipper compartment i was thinking
about using this to hold my art supplies
so i can just throw it into my bag or
something but i'm actually starting
school again so i'm not too sure if i'll
use it for that instead i don't really
know yet i also got these really nice
masking tapes one in red and the other
in green i always carry around masking
tape in my bag and also if you know me i
i don't know i love tape so i thought
that i would get a few more while i was
ordering from here plus i really liked
the more retro and versatile design of
these ones
i love pens and i especially love korean
ballpoint pens they're kind of different
they are so smooth and easy to write
with while having a really fine and
precise tip ballpoint pens are also
really nice to draw with because you can
go over them with water or any kind of
medium without worrying about the ink
bleeding
[Music]
growing up i loved miffy and i think the
pure graphics of the art of miffy left a
really huge impression on me i picked up
some postcards that feature some of the
elements in the miffy world and i'm
planning on just i don't know maybe just
hanging them up in my room since i'm
moving soon i decided to get an alarm
clock for my room i'm hoping that this
will prevent me from setting like 10
alarms on my phone that go off in the
morning
but we'll see i kind of doubt it
so i wanted to show y'all some
experiments i did in the odd orange
sketchbook using the art supplies i
received from choosing keeping first i
tested out the whole wine colored
pencils and tried just some different
techniques like layering different
colors on top of each other to see if i
could get new colors out of them because
of the limited number of colors within
this pencil set it was really easy to
create an illustration with a cohesive
color palette but at the same time it
didn't feel restricting or limiting at
all the paper of the sketchbook is just
exactly how i like my sketchbook paper
where it's tough enough to handle
different mediums but also doesn't feel
too thick and heavy to the point where
it feels precious the tooth and texture
of this paper was also perfect it wasn't
smooth to the point where the color
pencils just felt like they were gliding
around everywhere but at the same time
the texture wasn't rough to the point
where it felt like it was just eating
away at the pencil
